title.value: GSMART - check S.M.A.R.T discs for errors

body.value:
Almost all laptop hard drives have the opportunity to be checked by a SMART interface. For this purpose use the Lubuntu tool Gsmart. Since it is not installed by default, it must be installed via the Ubuntu Software Center. Select Gsmart and install it. After installation start it and start a check. There is a a quick check (about 10-20 minutes) or a detailed check (about 30 - 60 minutes).
In case you want to check a large number of discs you can buy a hard disc adapter e.g. from Logilink or other companies. The adapter will support IDE and SATA via an adapter and usually plugged in via USB http://www.logilink.eu/produkte/logilink_usb_adapter.htm
The advantage is that the disc is checked externally without having to open the laptop and you can adress it as 2nd drive (usually sdb).
